column5: Processed foods are a much bigger health problem than we thought PEP BYND TSN GIS voxcomscienceandhealth The microbiome idea may also help explain why highly processed diets cause people to eat more Gewirtz said Antagonizing the microbiota by highly processed diets starving it by removing fiber and attacking it with emulsifiers promotes inflammation That can hamper the bodys ability to feel satiated and result in overeating For example he explained eating causes the body to release the hormone leptin which quells hunger But inflammation interferes with leptins actionPut another way our results do not question the notion that the obesity epidemic is driven by overeating he added Rather it suggests that such overeating is driven in part by alterations in the microbiome inducing inflammation

Barclays How popular meat plantbased burgers compare Vendors BYND MFICA TSN LCA Purdue Nestle Kraft Dr Praegers ImpossibleVegans or vegetarians make up about 3 of the US population Thesis There are lots of Americans who are meat eaters and always will be but who are up for trying plantbased products as long as theyre tasty cheap and nutritious Tasty Not bad IMHO but wont be a regular purchase Will not be my goto protein source Ill stick to fish dairy legumes Cheap No Beyond Burger sells for about 12lb two 4oz patties retail for 599 Whole Foods 365 brand vegetable burger patties sell for 640lb ground beef goes for 5lb at the same store Nutritious Same saturated fat but too much sodium

BYND Clearly in a bubble with its 35 PE This is a processed foods company like TSN There is no reason it should be trading at multiples higher than a tech company However I wouldnt short either The premium to borrow shares is just too much and you wouldnt make a sizable profit The only way to win here is to stay away
